name: Hard Name That Dynasty! Quiz / Test | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Qian Long, Yong Zheng, Kang Xi...they were emperors during which Chinese dynasty?
questions.explanation:
Qing.

	Qing, the Manchus....the last dynasty of imperial China.  The Qing were in power in China from 1644 to 1912, when the last emperor Puyi abdicated his throne.

questions.text: Henry II, John, Richard I: They reigned in which English house?
questions.explanation:
Plantagenet.

	The Plantegenet Dynasty of England is also known as the Angevin Dynasty.  Henry II became the first Angevin monarch in 1154.

questions.text: Philip VI, John II, Charles V: Of which French ruling house were they a part?
questions.explanation:
Valois.

	All were members of the house of Valois, which lasted from 1328-1589.

questions.text: Cambyses, Cyrus the Great, Darius III....were all part of what ancient Persian dynasty?
questions.explanation:
Achaemenid.

	Cyrus the Great was the first Achaemenid emperor during the 6th century B.C.  The dynasty was named for one of his ancestors.

questions.text: Babur, Aurangzeb, Shah Jahan....all members of which Islamic dynasty in India?
questions.explanation:
Mughal.

	Babur, aka Zahir Muhammad, was the first Mughal emperor.  The dynasty lasted in India from the 16th to the 19th centuries.  It was toppled by the British.

questions.text: What was the name of the dynasty started by Charlemagne?
questions.explanation:
Carolingian.

	The name 'Carolingian' is derived from the German name for Charlemagne.  This Frankish dynasty did not last long, beginning with Charlemagne's ascension in 800 A.D. and ending with the division of his empire amongst his sons...

questions.text: What was the name of the empire started by Shi Huangdi, first emperor of unified China?
questions.explanation:
Qin.

	The Qin (alternatively spelled 'Chin' and 'Ch'in') Dynasty came into being in 221 B.C.  Prior to his ascension as emperor of all China Shi Huangdi was known as King Zheng.

questions.text: Charles V, Maximilian I, Maria Theresa...they were members of what Central European dynasty?
questions.explanation:
Hapsburg.

	The Hapsburg had their fingers in many pies, ruling over Austria, Spain, the Low Countries, Mexico, Germany, Hungary and others over its 600+ year history.  The last Hapsburg ruler was Charles I of Austria-Hungary, who abdicated in 1918.

questions.text: Nariaki, Ieyasu, Yoshimune....all belonged to which Japanese shogunate?
questions.explanation:
Tokugawa.

	The Tokugawa Shogunate took power in 1600 with the ascension of Ieyasu.  That Dynasty lasted until 1867, when the Meiji Emperor took the Japanese throne.

questions.text: What dynasty, founded in Northern Africa, was named for Mohammed's daughter?
questions.explanation:
Fatimid.

	One of Muhammad's favorite daughters was Fatima, and her legacy was such that her name was chosen for an entire Islamic Dynasty.  Thank you for attempting this quiz, I hope that you enjoyed it...please try some of my other quizzes if this is the case.
